poem:
### Water Ascending

The tap whispers of a slow tide rise,  
coins trickling down pipes,  
turning tumble into gulp.  
A kettle moans,  
calculating the math of thirst;  
pennies dance in a sink's whirl.  
The morning paper reports it all,  
black type on white,  
as if to say,  
even water wears a price tag now.
